0: A Tallahassee woman is suing a Mexican restaurant after she fell off its donkey statue and broke her back, according to a lawsuit. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Kimberly Bonn‘s complaint, filed last week in Leon County Circuit Civil court, said she was having dinner at El Jalisco Southwood restaurant on Aug. 31, 2015. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Afterward, she got up on a “life-size statue of a donkey,” upon which the restaurant encouraged patrons to have their photos taken, the suit said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR But the complaint says the donkey statue had no “ladder, step … or other safety feature,” nor did it have a “saddle or seat.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Where Bonn sat “was smooth and slick” and she slipped off. She fell “hard to the floor” and sustained a “fractured spine,” the suit said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Bonn, who is represented by James Biggart of the Morgan & Morgan personal injury law firm, seeks damages of more than $15,000. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The restaurant has not yet responded to the suit, according to court dockets. A manager who answered the phone said there was no comment.
